item.description:
A reporter from The Boston Globe will be joining our group for this movie.

This 2006 German Film described as "an intricate, ambiguous and deeply satisfying movie, a tautly plotted tale of state surveillance and personal betrayal that ultimately becomes an ode to the transformative power of art", is set in East Germany in the Orwellian year of 1984.

Since it won the Oscar, it might be a good idea to get there a bit early so that you can get a good seat.

Georg Dreyman is a successful playwright whose works always remain within the bounds of political correctness. He is having an affair with lead actress, Christa-Maria, who has also attracted the interest of a certain high-ranking East German Official. Georg must now be proven a traitor and in steps long-time surveillance expert Gerd Weisler. Weisler, whose own bureaucratic life is as dull as a cockroach's, however, is slowly drawn into these other people's lives- their humanity, passion, and idealism. The same traits he so sorely lacks.

This movie swept the German equivalent of the Oscars. Here is a complete review:
http://www.slate.com/...

After the movie, Tom will be holding a Meetup sign near the front row and then its off to a local eatery to discuss.
